(Use relations: 1 Byte = 8 bits, 1 MB = 1000 B, 1 GB = 1000 M and so on)

questions.question_text_1: Consider a server that has an Intel i5 processor, 64 GB RAM, 1 TB Hard disk with 3 Gbps network connection. If a client accesses a web page, it requires 1.5 MB. questions.question_text_1: The speed vs. throughput characteristics of a typical HDD is shown in the figure below. If this HDD is to be used as a replacement of an SSD whose read/write speed is 450 MB/s. At what speed (in RPM) should the disk of HDD rotate with to deliver the same performance as that of the SSD?

props.summary:
Here’s a structured summary of the **core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** essential for the **"Modern Application Development 1"** exam, along with **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- ## **1. Core Topics & Concepts** ### **A. Web Development Fundamentals** #### **1. URL Structure** - **Components**: - **Protocol** (`https`, `http`) - **Domain Name** (`www.example.com`) - **Path/Directory** (`/home`) - **Query Parameters** (`?user=Mad1&key=madcs2003`) - **Fragment** (`#section1`) #### **2. HTTP Methods** - **GET**: Retrieve data. - **POST**: Submit data (create/update). - **PUT/PATCH**: Update existing data. - **DELETE**: Remove data. #### **3. Flask Framework** - **Routing**: `@app.route('/path')` - **Templates (Jinja2)**: - `render_template()` - Loops (`{% for %}`), conditionals (`{% if %}`), filters (`{{ var | filter }}`). - **Request Handling**: - `request.args` (GET parameters) - `request.form` (POST form data) - `request.json` (JSON payload) - **Redirects & Errors**: - `redirect(url_for('route'))` - `abort(404)` - **Flask-RESTful**: - `Resource`, `Api`, `reqparse`, `fields`, `marshal_with`. - **Flask-SQLAlchemy**: - **Model Definition**: ```python class User(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) name = db.Column(db.String(50)) ``` - **CRUD Operations**: - `User.query.filter_by(name="Alice").first()` - `db.session.add(user)` - `db.session.commit()` - **Relationships**: - `db.relationship("ChildModel", backref="parent")` - `db.ForeignKey("parent.id")` #### **4. HTML & CSS** - **HTML Structure**: - ``, ``, ``, ``, `
`, ``, `

`, `

-

`. - **CSS Selectors**: - **ID**: `#id { color: red; }` - **Class**: `.class { color: blue; }` - **Element**: `p { font-size: 14px; }` - **Combinators**: `div > p`, `div p`, `div + p`. - **Box Model**: - `margin`, `border`, `padding`, `content`. - **Inline vs. Internal vs. External CSS**. #### **5. Jinja2 Templating** - **Variables**: `{{ variable }}` - **Control Structures**: - `{% if condition %} ... {% endif %}` - `{% for item in list %} ... {% endfor %}` - **Macros**: ```jinja2 {% macro greet(name) %} Hello, {{ name }}! {% endmacro %} ``` - **Filters**: - `{{ list|length }}` - `{{ text|upper }}` #### **6. RESTful APIs** - **Endpoints**: - `GET /users` → List all users. - `POST /users` → Create a user. - `PUT /users/` → Update a user. - `DELETE /users/` → Delete a user. - **Status Codes**: - `200 OK` - `201 Created` - `400 Bad Request` - `404 Not Found` - `500 Server Error` #### **7. Testing (Pytest)** - **Fixtures**: ```python @pytest.fixture def sample_data(): return {"key": "value"} ``` - **Assertions**: ```python def test_example(sample_data): assert sample_data["key"] == "value" ``` - **Test Isolation**: Each test runs independently. --- ### **B. Mathematics & Algorithms** #### **1. Time Complexity** - **Big-O Notation**: - `O(1)`: Constant time. - `O(n)`: Linear time. - `O(n log n)`: Linearithmic time (e.g., Merge Sort). - `O(n²)`: Quadratic time (e.g., Bubble Sort). - **Example**: - Sorting `n` items with `O(n log n)`: - For `n=500`, time `T1 = k * 500 * log(500)`. - For `n=1200`, time `T2 = k * 1200 * log(1200)`. - Ratio: `T2/T1 = (1200 * log(1200)) / (500 * log(500)) ≈ 2.73`. - If `T1 = 100s`, then `T2 ≈ 273s`. #### **2. Bandwidth & Throughput** - **Bandwidth (Gbps)**: - `1 Byte = 8 bits`. - `1 MB = 1000 KB = 10^6 Bytes`. - `1 GB = 1000 MB = 10^9 Bytes`. - **Throughput Calculation**: - **Example**: - Original: `10,000 requests * 150 KB = 1.5 GB = 12 Gb`. - New: `12,500 requests * 180 KB = 2.25 GB = 18 Gb`. - Increase: `18 Gb - 12 Gb = 6 Gb` → **6 Gbps**. #### **3. HDD vs. SSD Performance** - **HDD Throughput**: - Linear relationship between **RPM** and **throughput (MB/s)**. - **Example**: - At `7200 RPM` → `150 MB/s`. - To match `450 MB/s` (SSD speed), HDD must spin at `7200 * (450/150) = 21,600 RPM`. - Closest option: **28,800 RPM**. --- ### **C. Database (SQLite & SQLAlchemy)** #### **1. SQL Queries** - **Filtering**: ```sql SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > 18; ``` - **Indexing**: ```sql CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_name ON table (column1, column2) WHERE condition; ``` - **Relationships**: - **One-to-Many**: ```python class Parent(db.Model): children = db.relationship("Child", backref="parent") class Child(db.Model): parent_id = db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey("parent.id")) ``` - **Querying**: ```python parent = Parent.query.get(1) children = parent.children # List of Child objects ``` #### **2. CRUD Operations** - **Create**: ```python user = User(name="Alice") db.session.add(user) db.session.commit() ``` - **Read**: ```python User.query.filter_by(name="Alice").first() ``` - **Update**: ```python user = User.query.get(1) user.name = "Bob" db.session.commit() ``` - **Delete**: ```python db.session.delete(user) db.session.commit() ``` --- ## **2. Key Equations** ### **A. Bandwidth Calculation** \[ \text{Total Data (bits)} = \text{Number of Requests} \times \text{Request Size (Bytes)} \times 8 \] \[ \text{Bandwidth (Gbps)} = \frac{\text{Total Data (bits)}}{10^9 \text{ (for GB)} \times \text{Time (s)}} \] ### **B. Time Complexity Scaling** For `O(n log n)`: \[ \frac{T_2}{T_1} = \frac{n_2 \log n_2}{n_1 \log n_1} \] ### **C. HDD RPM to Throughput** \[ \text{Throughput (MB/s)} \propto \text{RPM} \] \[ \text{Required RPM} = \text{Current RPM} \times \frac{\text{Desired Throughput}}{\text{Current Throughput}} \] --- ## **3. Mermaid Knowledge Graphs** ### **Graph 1: Web Development Concepts** ```mermaid graph TD A[Web Development] --> B[Frontend] A --> C[Backend] B --> D[HTML] B --> E[CSS] B --> F[JavaScript] C --> G[Flask] C --> H[Database] G --> I[Routing] G --> J[Templating] G --> K[RESTful APIs] H --> L[SQLite] H --> M[SQLAlchemy] ``` ### **Graph 2: Flask Workflow** ```mermaid graph LR A[Client Request] --> B[Flask Route] B --> C[Request Handling] C --> D[Database Query] C --> E[Template Rendering] D --> F[SQLAlchemy] E --> G[Jinja2] F --> H[Response] G --> H H --> I[Client] ``` ### **Graph 3: HTTP Methods & Status Codes** ```mermaid graph TD A[HTTP Methods] --> B[GET] A --> C[POST] A --> D[PUT] A --> E[DELETE] B --> F[200 OK] C --> G[201 Created] D --> H[200 OK] E --> I[204 No Content] F --> J[404 Not Found] G --> J ``` ### **Graph 4: SQLAlchemy Relationships** ```mermaid graph TD A[Parent Model] -->|One-to-Many| B[Child Model] B -->|ForeignKey| A A --> C[db.relationship] C --> D[backref] ``` ### **Graph 5: Testing with Pytest** ```mermaid graph TD A[Pytest] --> B[Fixtures] A --> C[Test Functions] B --> D[setup_data] C --> E[assert statements] D --> F[Reusable Data] E --> G[Pass/Fail] ``` ### **Graph 6: Bandwidth & Throughput** ```mermaid graph LR A[Requests] -->|x Size| B[Total Data] B -->|/ Time| C[Bandwidth] C --> D[Gbps] ``` ### **Graph 7: Time Complexity** ```mermaid graph TD A[Algorithm] --> B[O(1)] A --> C[O(n)] A --> D[O(n log n)] A --> E[O(n²)] D --> F[Sorting] ``` --- ## **4. Exam Preparation Checklist** | **Topic** | **Key Concepts** | |-------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | **URL Structure** | Protocol, domain, path, query parameters, fragments. | | **Flask Routing** | `@app.route`, `request.args`, `request.json`, `render_template`. | | **Jinja2 Templating** | Loops, conditionals, filters, macros. | | **HTTP Methods** | GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, status codes. | | **Flask-RESTful** | `Resource`, `Api`, `reqparse`, `marshal_with`. | | **SQLAlchemy** | Model definition, relationships, CRUD, queries. | | **HTML/CSS** | Selectors, box model, inline/internal/external CSS. | | **Bandwidth Calculation** | Request size, number of requests, conversion (Bytes → bits → Gbps). | | **Time Complexity** | Big-O notation, scaling for `O(n log n)`. | | **HDD vs. SSD** | RPM → throughput, linear scaling. | | **Testing (Pytest)** | Fixtures, assertions, test isolation. |
